articles.description: England recall James Anderson for the fourth Ashes Test at Old Trafford, in place of Ollie Robinson.
articles.title: Anderson replaces Robinson for England in fourth Ashes Test

articles.description: Australia's Cameron Smith says he was "holding back tears" as he handed the Claret Jug back to the R&A on Monday after arriving at Royal Liverpool for the Open Championship.
articles.title: Smith emotional handing back Claret Jug

articles.description: England spinner Moeen Ali wants to find the fan who helped him cure the cut finger that was affecting his bowling at the beginning of the Ashes series.
articles.title: Moeen looking for fan who cured finger injury

articles.description: Inter Miami and David Beckham unveil Lionel Messi as their new signing after thunderstorms delay the presentation.
articles.title: 'America's number 10!' - Messi unveiled in Miami

articles.description: Novak Djokovic has been fined 8,000 US dollars (£6,117) for smashing his racquet against a net post in the Wimbledon men's final.
articles.title: Djokovic fined for smashing racquet in final loss

articles.description: Australia's women's team criticise the gender disparity in World Cup prize money and some nations not having collective bargaining rights.
articles.title: Australia criticise World Cup gender pay disparity

articles.description: Watch how Rafael Nadal and Carlos Alcaraz won Wimbledon with an incredibly similar point in 2008 and 2023.
articles.title: From 2008-2023: How Nadal & Alcaraz won Wimbledon

articles.description: Britain's Aled Sion Davies wins his fifth consecutive shot put title at the Para Athletics World Championships.
articles.title: Davies claims fifth world shot put crown

articles.description: Rory McIlroy's victory at the Scottish Open stokes expectations as he returns to Royal Liverpool in Hoylake, the scene of his only Open victory, writes Iain Carter.
articles.title: 'McIlroy's win heightens excitement for Open week'

articles.description: The men's Wimbledon final between Carlos Alcaraz and Novak Djokovic records a peak audience of 11.3m on BBC One.
articles.title: Epic Alcaraz-Djokovic final peaks at 11.3m BBC viewers
